news.forms module

Form definitions for the News application.

This module contains Django ModelForms used to create, update, and manage articles, publishers, newsletters, and reader subscriptions.

Forms implement role-based behavior and validation logic for: - Journalists - Editors - Readers

class news.forms.ArticleForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

Form used to create and update Article instances.

Behavior differs depending on the role: - Journalists can create and edit articles and choose publishers - Editors can only approve or unapprove existing articles

Validation ensures correct handling of independent vs publisher-affiliated articles.

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

clean()[source]

Perform cross-field validation.

Enforces the following rules: - Independent articles cannot be linked to a publisher - Publisher-affiliated articles must have a publisher selected - Editor mode preserves hidden field values

Returns:

Cleaned form data.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

ValidationError – If validation rules are violated.

property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class news.forms.NewsletterForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

Form used by journalists to create and update newsletters.

Supports both: - Independent newsletters - Publisher-affiliated newsletters

Articles are dynamically filtered based on newsletter type and approval status.

news.models module

Database models for the News application.

This module defines the core data structures used throughout the system: - Publisher: Represents a news publishing organization - Article: Represents a news article written by a journalist - Newsletter: Represents a curated collection of articles

These models enforce relationships between journalists, editors, publishers, and readers, and support both independent and publisher-affiliated content.

class news.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a news article written by a journalist.

Articles may be: - Independent (written and published directly by a journalist) - Publisher-affiliated (requiring editorial approval)

Articles support approval workflows and publication metadata.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

approved_by_editor

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

articles_included

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

publisher_id
refresh_from_db(using=None, fields=None, from_queryset=None)

Reload field values from the database.

By default, the reloading happens from the database this instance was loaded from, or by the read router if this instance wasn’t loaded from any database. The using parameter will override the default.

Fields can be used to specify which fields to reload. The fields should be an iterable of field attnames. If fields is None, then all non-deferred fields are reloaded.

When accessing deferred fields of an instance, the deferred loading of the field will call this method.

save_base(raw=False, force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)

Handle the parts of saving which should be done only once per save, yet need to be done in raw saves, too. This includes some sanity checks and signal sending.

The ‘raw’ argument is telling save_base not to save any parent models and not to do any changes to the values before save. This is used by fixture loading.

class news.models.Newsletter(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a newsletter containing a curated collection of articles.

Newsletters can be: - Independent (created by a journalist) - Publisher-affiliated (distributed by a publisher)

Readers gain access to newsletters based on their subscriptions.

class news.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a news publisher organization.

A publisher can have multiple journalists and editors associated with it. Publishers are responsible for approving and distributing articles and newsletters created under their organization.

news.signals module

Signals file to handle user groups creations and sending emails and tweeits when a publisher article is approved.

news.signals.create_groups_and_assign_permissions(sender, **kwargs)[source]

Create default user groups and assign permissions.

news.signals.email_publisher_article(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]

Send email and tweet notifications when an article is approved.

This signal is triggered after an Article instance is saved. Notifications are only sent when: - The article already existed (not created) - The is_approved field has changed - The new value of is_approved is True

Parameters:

  • sender (Model) – The model class sending the signal.

  • instance (Article) – The saved Article instance.

  • created (bool) – Indicates if the instance was created.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments.

Returns:

None

news.urls module

news.views_editors module

Editor views for the News application.

This module contains all editor-facing views responsible for managing articles and newsletters that belong to publishers the editor is associated with.

Editors can: - View all articles for their publishers - View, update, and delete individual articles - View, update, and delete newsletters for their publishers

All views enforce: - User authentication - Editor role authorization - Object-level access control via publisher-editor relationships

news.views_editors.all_articles(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Display all articles belonging to publishers the editor is assigned to.

Editors can only view articles associated with publishers where they are listed as an editor.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

Rendered dashboard with article list or redirect on error

news.views_editors.all_newsletters(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Display all newsletters belonging to publishers the editor manages.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

Rendered newsletter dashboard

news.views_editors.delete_article(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Delete an article owned by the editor’s publisher.

Deletion is only allowed after POST confirmation.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the article

Returns:

Confirmation page or redirect after deletion

news.views_editors.delete_newsletter(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Delete a newsletter owned by the editor’s publisher.

Deletion requires POST confirmation.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the newsletter

Returns:

Confirmation page or redirect after deletion

news.views_editors.helpers = <helpers.index.Helpers object>

on get_object_pr_404, i now addded publisher__editors=request.user

news.views_editors.update_article(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Update an existing article.

Editors are limited to approving or rejecting articles. Publisher and independence fields are preserved and hidden.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the article

Returns:

Rendered form or redirect after successful update

news.views_editors.update_newsletter(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Update an existing newsletter.

Editors can modify the newsletter content and associated articles.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the newsletter

Returns:

Rendered form or redirect after successful update

news.views_editors.view_article(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Display a single article for editor review.

Access is restricted to articles that belong to a publisher the editor is associated with.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the article

Returns:

Rendered article view or redirect on error

news.views_editors.view_newsletter(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Display a single newsletter for editor review.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the newsletter

Returns:

Rendered newsletter detail view

news.views_journalist module

Journalist views for the News application.

This module contains all view logic related to journalists, including creating, reading, updating, and deleting articles and newsletters.

Access to all views in this module is restricted to authenticated users with the journalist role. Object-level permissions are enforced using filtered get_object_or_404 queries to ensure journalists may only interact with their own content.

news.views_journalist.create_article(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Handles the creation of a new article by a journalist.

GET: Renders an empty ArticleForm. POST: Validates the form and saves the article with the

logged-in journalist as the author.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The incoming HTTP request.

Returns:

Rendered form template or redirect to dashboard

on successful creation.

Return type:

HttpResponse

news.views_journalist.create_newsletter(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Create a new newsletter for the logged-in journalist.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request.

Returns:

Rendered form or redirect to newsletter dashboard.

Return type:

HttpResponse

news.views_journalist.update_article(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Updates an article authored by the logged-in journalist.

GET: Renders ArticleForm prefilled with existing data. POST: Validates the form and updates the article.

If linked to a publisher, resets approval and independent flags.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The incoming HTTP request.

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the Article to update.

Returns:

Rendered form template or redirect to dashboard on success.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – Incoming HTTP request.

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the newsletter.

Returns:

Rendered form or redirect on success.

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the Article to view.

news.views_publishers module

Publisher management views for the News application.

This module provides manager-level functionality for creating, viewing, updating, and deleting publishers.

Access is restricted to authenticated users with the manager_publishers role.

This functionality was not required, however it makes it a bit easier for the user to create and manage the publishers without going into the admin site. However creating a superuser will be needed to access this part of the application.

Managers can: - Create new publishers - View all publishers - Search publishers by name or description - View publisher details - Update publisher information - Delete publishers

news.views_publishers.create_publisher(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Create a new publisher.

Validates uniqueness of the publisher name before saving. If a publisher with the same name already exists, an error message is displayed and the form is re-rendered.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

Rendered form or redirect to publisher list on success

news.views_publishers.delete_publisher(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Delete a publisher.

Deletion requires POST confirmation to prevent accidental removal.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the publisher

Returns:

Confirmation page or redirect after deletion

news.views_publishers.publisher_details(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Display detailed information for a single publisher.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the publisher

Returns:

Rendered publisher detail page or redirect if not found

news.views_publishers.read_publishers(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Display a list of all publishers.

Supports optional search functionality using query parameters to filter publishers by name or description.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

Rendered publisher list view

news.views_publishers.update_publisher(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Update an existing publisher.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the publisher

Returns:

Rendered form or redirect after successful update

news.views_reader module

Reader views for the News application.

This module provides functionality for authenticated readers to: - View articles based on their subscriptions - Search articles and newsletters - View individual articles and newsletters - Manage publisher and journalist subscriptions

Access to all views is restricted to users with the reader role. Content visibility is determined by the reader’s active subscriptions.

news.views_reader.all_newsletters(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Display all newsletters available to the reader.

Newsletters are filtered based on the reader’s subscriptions: - Publisher newsletters from subscribed publishers - Independent newsletters from subscribed journalists

Supports optional search functionality by title or journalist name.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

Rendered newsletter dashboard

news.views_reader.get_all_articles(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Display all articles available to the logged-in reader.

Articles are filtered based on the reader’s subscriptions: - Publisher articles from subscribed publishers - Independent articles from subscribed journalists

Supports optional search functionality by article title or journalist name.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

Rendered article dashboard

news.views_reader.manage_subscriptions(request: HttpRequest)[source]

Manage reader subscriptions to publishers and journalists.

Allows the reader to subscribe or unsubscribe from available publishers and journalists using a single form.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object

Returns:

Rendered subscription form or redirect on success

news.views_reader.view_article(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Display a single article to the reader.

Access is allowed only if the article exists. Subscription checks are enforced at the listing level.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the article

Returns:

Rendered article detail view

news.views_reader.view_newsletter(request: HttpRequest, pk: int)[source]

Display a single newsletter to the reader.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object

  • pk – Primary key of the newsletter

Returns:

Rendered newsletter detail view
